intro: Phlegmariurus ulixis, commonly known as the zigzag moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, undulating leaf arrangement that gives it its common name. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its structure consists of a thalloid body with distinct leaf-like structures called phyllidia. Phlegmariurus ulixis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecological niche.
